predicate.note: Frames file for 'disgorge' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 10.1, verbs of removing.

roleset.name: remove

example.name: meaning 'fined'
example.text: The following were neither barred nor suspended: Stephanie Veselich Enright, Rolling Hills, Calif., fined $2,500 and ordered *trace *trace* to disgorge $11,762;...
example.arg: *trace* -> *trace* -> Stephanie Veselich Enright, Rolling Hills, Calif.,

roleset.note: There's apparently some subtle difference between being fined and disgorging cash, but I don't know what it is.

example.name: literal sense
example.text: John disgorged his lunch from his stomach.

roleset.note: 'Gorge' literally means 'throat', so to disgorge is to remove from the throat, or vomit. Sorry about that.
